website_summaries.verdict: This cordless trimmer stands up to wet, tall wild grass, as well as less challenging lawn tasks.
pros: 3-in-1 power tool handles trimming, edging, and mowing
Tool-free conversion from trimmer to edger with additional height and angle adjustments for comfort
Telescopic height adjustments with quick-release lever
cons: Auto-feed function does not work as expected

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Pros - light weight, small but powerful battery Cons - does not feed automatically as advertised, power to the cutting string is too low, i.e. will not cut well, cutting string is too small to edge properly, since string does not let out properly, the wheels cause the cut to be too shallow, overall it has a cheap, fragile look & feel. I would not recommend this item at all.
customer_reviews.author: Slayda

customer_reviews.title: Great power, but wasting time with string breaking
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because I had owned an older Worx for about eight years. This one does have much more power and the battery will do my entire large yard. The problem is with the new one the string doesn't feed properly. I contacted Worx looking for an expanded view of how the string should be installed as I thought maybe it was different than the old one. They wouldn't send it to me. I was asking via email. I thought the customer service left a lot to be desired. The whole time I owned my original Worx I never had the string break or not feed.
customer_reviews.author: BILLIE

customer_reviews.title: ... for a couple of seasons now and am continually disappointed. The auto-feed feature is useless
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for a couple of seasons now and am continually disappointed. The auto-feed feature is useless. You have to constantly (like every 5-10 seconds) start and stop the trigger to get the line to feed. I end up having to manually re-feed the spool a few times every time I use it. The metal bump guard at the front makes it very difficult to trim near a fence and get all the grass. Ultimately, I end up going back to my cheap Black & Decker trimmer vs. this one. The only reason I use this is because the battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: What a wondrous whacker!
customer_reviews.text: When my previous weed whacker showed signs of a weak and warped whack wheel, I decided to give this wheeled WORX widget a whirl. Well, I whimsically witnessed a wanton whirlwind of winnowed weedy wreckage when this whiplash WORX whacker went to work. The 32 volt workhorse whirled unwaveringly to wipe-out weeks of wild growth edging my walkways and walls. This wonder of workmanship weighed little, which wrapped up the workload without undue weariness. With the WORX wound up, the charger was also wise enough to withhold wattage when the battery is already awash, wired and waiting for the next week.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain of Tech

customer_reviews.title: not on irregular terrain
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that the mini mower would work well for me, as I am a senior, with limited arm strength and cannot run a regular mower. I didn't mind it spitting grass back at me, but it could not maneuver well over the irregular grass terrain in both the front and back yards. I think a small 4-wheeler would have been a better bet.
customer_reviews.author: Fran S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice string trimmer. It does everything that I want and it is pretty easy to adjust and change to your needs. Battery did take about 5 hours to charge to full. But it lasted doing my whole house. I live in suburbs on 0.3 acre lot so I don't have a whole bunch to do but it was still going after 20 minutes of edging and trimming. I'm worried about the strings since the spool is tiny! But it does do a better job than my old .045 string electric trimmer. I like the portability with the battery. I wouldn't recommend this for large, thick brush but for your average suburban home owner, this is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: GMK

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is light weight but it is flimsy and parts don't stay in place. The line for trimming is on the tiniest spool I've ever seen and it's so thin and fragile it takes a lot more than standard trim wire. I have back trouble and wanted to like this but it took me longer to edge and just felt like it was about to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Coni

customer_reviews.title: Love the mini mower feature
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. My main purpose of buying this product is for the mini mower. I have little amount of grass in my back yard and this works perfectly. It does not cut the grass down real short which is perfect because the area does not get a lot of sun. I like that I also have the trimmer; my husband has a gas trimmer and it is hard for to start with low back problems. This is great, just put the battery in and push your button to run. Well worth the money for me. I am now able to trim the grass in the front to help hubby out.
customer_reviews.author: flowerpowerrkr

customer_reviews.title: BEST WEEDEATER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I totally LOVE this weedeater. Highly recommend for ANYONE. It’s super light weight, but very strong. It doesn’t wear me out after using for long periods of time. It can plow down thicker weeds and grasses. The flower guard protects plants so you can do very detailed weedeating, and get right up under bushes and even small flowers. The battery life is excellent on the 32v. I can weedeat around my 8 fruit/oak trees, sidewalks, and flowerbed boarders on a full charge with a bit of charge leftover, but I usually recharge to do the entire fence line on my half acre yard. Im sure I could do the whole thing on one charge if I had the 48v battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Light, adjustable, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's very light, hold battery charge well, and best of all it's adjustable in height and the direction of cutting. The wheels are fantastic because you don't have to keep trying to hold it at a certain height or distance, instead you just roll it along the grass line. I had an older grass trimmer but it was heavy and not adjustable in any way. This thing makes trimming such a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: I liked that it was light weight
customer_reviews.text: The charger light never came on. The charger didn’t work. I was able to use it about minutes and then it quit. I tried charging it for 24 hours, but the charger didn’t work. I liked that it was light weight. It probably would have done the job if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jay May

customer_reviews.title: good for neighborhood lot.
customer_reviews.text: it's good for edging and light weed eating.battery lasts about 30-40 minutes,comes with 2 of them so that's good.very light,the wheel attachment is good for edging,not so much for weed eating.string breaks kind of easy because it's thinner than that on a gas weed eater.if you have heavy grass or weeds you probably would be better off with something a little more powerfull.if you have a normal size [maybe 1/3 acre suburban lot] this would probably work for you.that's what i have and i'm going to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good, well designed product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good, well designed product. The only downside is the cost of replacement batteries. I've been using the 24V version for several years and it provided good service, however, the battery recently stopped holding a charge and a single replacement battery was around $100 dollars! I think this is a poor business practice on the part of Worx but, since it's worked well, I thought it made more sense to buy a new trimmer that included two batteries for about $150,
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and good power.
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool and use it a lot. Battery good for about 2 hours and takes 4-5 hours to charge. That's OK, you want to make sure these batteries stay cool while charging. I plug in my charger outside and leave it outside while recharging. The cutting line is small. I will look for heavier cutting line when this is used up. Convenience of cordless is a BIG PLUS. So, although it feels flimsy, I think that is the trade-off for light weight and ease of use. I recommend it to friends..
customer_reviews.author: Stan L.

customer_reviews.title: Worx Works ! !
customer_reviews.text: Five stars plus for this machine. 32 volts is plenty of power to trim the whole backyard ( 200' x 140' ) and then, with the same battery, switched to the 32 volt blower, and blow off the sidewalks and steps, and still have enough power to do more. At 74 years of age it's good to have light weight equipment that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney E. Colling

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer with good battery life
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to replace a gas trimmer that always had line tangle issues. I was impressed how well this works. The wheel and the guard make is easy to roll it along the fence and trim. I have a 1/4 acre yard and this has plenty of power on a charge to take care of that, and there is no perceivable battery drain. Much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: T Towns

customer_reviews.title: I DO NOT recommend-Real disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: Two batteries didn't get front & back yard. By the time you readjust the thing to do edging, trimming, etc you are exhausted. Bought because of the rave reviews about strength and light weight because I recently had neck surgery. Lightweight yes but I was more tired after fooling with this thing and going over spots over & over because it wasn't strong enough to do what my gas one would do in a 1/4 of the time. I think the reviews must be from employees or something. I followed every instruction to a tee and got not 1 result as shown on commercial. I hate having to use gas but this just isn't there. I need Tessa power!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer---best I have owned---cordless! Multiple performances----trims around sidewalk, driveway, etc. and works great to keep gardens edged nicely without having to install a barrier to separate garden from grass. Love it so far---easy to change line reel. Runs for a long time on charge---I can do both my large front and back yards without running out of power. Cleans up well. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Christine M. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have purposely not left a review until I had a chance to use this trimmer a couple of times. I very much like this trimmer! It was easy to assemble, easy to use. I don't have a large yard but it takes about 20 minutes to trim. I was able to trim two times with this trimmer which I felt was very good for the size of the battery. It stopped just as I was finishing! Good timing! I would recommend this trimmer, as I mentioned, it is easy to use and not very heavy...easy on the back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The brand name says it all it "WORX"
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product for what it does. It's versatile. It does what it suppose to do. It's light. Battery power is just enough for front yard and backyard. It has a lot of power. Easy to use and make adjustment on a fly. It's not loud. I was skeptical on getting it. I like gasoline powered. This one does the job. I relied on the reviews here. I just have to get use to the sound and single string cut.
customer_reviews.author: Ros Donida

customer_reviews.title: Not an upgrade in product
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to have as much power as my old worx 20v weed eater but the new one seems to last a little longer time wise on the battery. The locking mechanism doesn't work at all and the head swivels in locking position. I really like the worx brand but I'm not impressed with what I thought was going to be an upgrade from a 20v to a 32v. Seems the technology and craftsmanship didn't improve unless I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best trimmer I have ever used! Easy, light weight, string lasts a long time, no fumes or excess noise. I have them all: DR Trimmer, gas, electric, edgers, etc. and this is positively my favorite. I am 75 years and even trimmed 75' of my neighbors curb. Also went to another home and edged it front & back. So simple to use. Check out the 20V with free lifetime string. They have improved the battery on it and that is what I would be buying if I didn't have this one first.
customer_reviews.author: byoung

customer_reviews.title: The service from Amazon was great! But the product was very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The service from Amazon was great! But the product was very disappointing. Could not get the line to rewind properly, one line insert per usage. Manual wind up for line does not work. Edging is nearly impossible. Called Customer service put me on hold for 45 min listing to recording on how great Worx products was and the another 45 min for a call back. They could not answer my questions probably the line was old and worn!! Please don't believe to propaganda you see on TV. Now can only use it to weed one spool at a time. A useless product.!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced by Worx
customer_reviews.text: Best trimmer I've ever owned but after two years it's quit working. Simply will not turn on; tried two different batteries, no response. Called Worx and they're sending me a new one. I just wanted some help on getting it fixed but they just replaced with the newest version. I have no idea if it's still under warranty (although the new one has a three year warranty, so maybe it still is under warranty) but no hassle, just offered me a new one for the cost of tax and shipping.
customer_reviews.author: MulderJL

customer_reviews.title: Hunk of Junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of Junk! The directions are a joke and the box it came in is more useful than this hunk of junk plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Luna

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional cordless trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely surprised with this product. It has a long battery life. It has superior power and cutting ability. It is very lightweight. It works like the power of a gas trimmer. The string is a breeze to use. It advances nicely. Easy to refill and lifetime free spools with registering the product. You only pay for shipping. Wish I had this trimmer a long time ago. Best one I have ever worked with.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: This has been wonderful so far
customer_reviews.text: OK, I've only had this about a month, but with a big yard to edge with sidewalks, 2 entrances to front of house, driveway and brick pavers in side yard, I have a lot to edge. I'm a 65 year old woman so I need light weight. The gas powered is too heavy for me. I tried another a battery powered and when something went wrong I could not even get anyone within 65 miles to look at it. Tried electric, but my yard is too big. This has been wonderful so far. Came with 2 batteries-awesome. Have used it several times and it does a great job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cis

customer_reviews.title: works for older female
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weed eater along with the 32V blower. I love them both. I picked this model because of the wheels and the light weight of the weed eater itself. It is adjustable in length, the folding handle adjusts, the weed eater part is easily adjusted and the wheels are easy to remove and turn. It is light weight but the wheels are great for going under chairs etc. and for when your arms get tired. Not as loud as a gas powered weed eater and easy to turn on and off. I would purchase this product again. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper's MomTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Toy Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is nothing more than a toy. Our recently planted zoysia grass, which is a fairly fine-bladed, was about 5-inches tall when I tried out the GT2.0. But for some reason, even though the battery was fully charged, it didn't cut it. Maybe the string is too thin, the rpms too low, or the motor not powerful enough? I'd like to return it, but I can't disassemble it without damaging it: The orange guard snaps into place and is impossible to take apart, and without removing it, the unit won't fit into the box. Save your money. I bought a Ryobi 18v lithium trimmer as a replacement for just a few dollars more. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: R. N. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: and for all that it is small and light weight it still has excellent power. It is easy to use and extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: It works amazingly well, and for all that it is small and light weight it still has excellent power. It is easy to use and extremely user friendly. Despite my many injuries and lifting restrictions, I can use this with little trouble. The wheels allow me to rest whenever I need to and also keep it from falling over when I don't have both hands on it. The only issue I have had with it, is making sharp turns can take a bit of maneuvering, but with the lightness of it, that really is not much trouble. I strongly recommend this product for anyone that is looking for a lightweight, durable, powerful, easy-to-use weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: This works great, light weight
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. I was skeptical when seeing the infomercial on TV, but after seeing the reviews I figured why not give it a try. This works great, light weight, long battery life, and very easy to convert to edger and back to weed trimmer. Note on if using as an edger, it's great for upkeep if you have been edging from time to time. I did have to bring out a dedicated edger with a metal blade for a strip I neglected for years. But now it's so easy I give a quick edge in minutes every time I cut the grass. I would definately buy again although the way it's built I probably won't have too.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: A great replacement for our gas trimmer. Powerful, the auto line feed is slick. Takes about an hour to charge fully. Only drawback is that over the course of a week it will lose it's charge. On a weekly basis I start the battery charging when I start to mow. The mowing takes an hour or so and by the time I'm done and ready to trim the trimmer is charges. Property is 2/3 of an acre with several gardens and paths to trim.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This product could not be more perfect for me. It is very light weight, the wheels allow me to reach under trees, furniture and any other hard to get at areas. It was easy to put together, easy to change positions and the battery affords me plenty of run time. I have used it many, many times for at least 30 minutes each time and have only had to recharge it after at least 6 uses. I let my "Macho" friend try it and his response was "this works better than my gas trimmer and it doesn't come with all the headaches!"
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this trimmer. It replaces and clunker gas powered trimmer that was nearly impossible to start. I really like that I can change it from a weed trimmer to an edger so easily! The battery lasts a long time - very surprised it was worked great for a months worth of weed eating around my house and I haven't charged it yet. Probably next time though...
customer_reviews.author: sturner

customer_reviews.title: Works great but some issues assembling it
customer_reviews.text: I've used it once so far and this product works well. But the issue is that the safe guard did not slide in. I spent over 2 hours trying to slide it in but it didn't work. Eventually I pushed it really hard and it slided in but only half way, so I can't screw in. I'm worried that the safe guard might come off eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Toshikazu Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: OK but would not recommend to purchase
customer_reviews.text: It is ok but nothing fantastic. Battery lasts less than one hour which barely is time enough to do a small part of my lawn. Good thing I have two batteries. The wheel feature is good only if you have a well manicured lawn. IE: trimming and edging every other day or so. I also have the blower and it only does a fair job. Not enough power. You would think it had enough with a 32 volt lithium battery. Not excited about either tool. Would not recommend to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D

customer_reviews.title: I'm Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked great. I first used it for about 10 minutes & left the battery attached to the trimmer. It was almost 2 weeks before I was able to use again. It takes about 40 minutes to do my yard. Before I had to use 2 of the Black & Decker 20 volts to accomplish the job. I finished the job & still have power left. I will let you know if that changes over the course of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: The Worx wasn't what I expected. Think twice before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: The edger doesn't give my sidewalk a clean edge. The line is difficult to feed when the trimmer is running. I loved my old Black and Decker edger/trimmer, but this one isn't work the money. The wheel bracket that you attach, for edging and using the "mini-mower" broke already.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Hard to flip
customer_reviews.text: It makes a great edger once I got used to how to hold it. However, It's difficult to change it from the flat mode for trimming & the side mode for edging. I not strong enough to work it easily. I use it as an edger to do all the edging & trimming.
customer_reviews.author: SEP

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I dig it. I have a cheaper battery powered weed eater that can't weed eat my small property on one charge. I also have a gas powered weed eater that I can't start. Then, I also have an edger that the motor died on. This thing is a beast right out of the box. I love how light it is, how long the battery can last, and that I can quickly edge my sidewalks. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: mfrazier

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but not without a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and so much easier to use than the corded type. The .065 line tends to jam in the spools occasionally (maybe due to streching and getting caught under adjacent line) and can be a hassle to free up.. Overall it seems a lot noisier than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Used, Handles tall grass
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used one from Amazon for half price. Works very well when fully charged and can handle tall weeds and grass. However charging takes about 12 hours for that power level so doing my property was a 3 day event. Would much prefer this model corded. I'm not sure I'd pay full price.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: but great adjustments. wheels are mounted on the guard making ...
customer_reviews.text: still too short for my 6ft frame. but great adjustments. wheels are mounted on the guard making for a flimsy, bouncy, ride. but good for the intended purpose of getting under things. battery life is ok but charging time is min. three hours. easy to store and the line feed works well. small line so thick work is harder. beats dragging a cord or mixing gas. I would recommend only for typical yard maintenance not heavy brush.and an extra battery would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: bamafan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer edger works perfectly and the fact that I can adjust it to be a 12 inch lawn mower comes in very handy in tight spots. String supplied is very tough and I have yet to replace a spool. Their free string policy sent me 8 additional spools which should last for quite a while. Buy it--you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: George Paquette

customer_reviews.title: learning how to use it
customer_reviews.text: My experience has been so-so. The spooling/cover is very sensitive. Hit a tough uneven area can cause problems as cover can break very easy, spool come undone. I really think the spool cover design is flawed. Worx needs to redesign. Trimming goes ok, Edging can be tricky as one can easily create a cavern if not watching it. Edge guide so so. Just a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Battery is horrible....Very few uses and it doesnt hold a charge.
customer_reviews.text: Battery is horrible.... few uses and it doesnt hold a charge. This 32v is dead and will not take a charge. i bought this because I pretty much have a small parking strip around planters and plants. Something small and easy. Well I havent used it much and the battery is toast. I own Dewalt 36v tools for 6 years now and use them alot more than this and they have barely lost power. I also own a chevy volt and have solar background. I keep my batteries topped off, meaning I know what to do to keep batteries working. It must just be low quality.
customer_reviews.author: crustomer#1

customer_reviews.title: OK for maintenance yardwork
customer_reviews.text: Ok Product. As other reviewers have commented, the nylon string breaks too easy and is a very very small spool. It is lightweight so easy for a woman to handle well. I find it a goid "maintenance" tool once you have your yard trimmed up first but it is not the workhorse I had hoped it might be
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but the string snaps easily.
customer_reviews.text: It's just "ok" but the string kept snapping off. The company said it was "old" string which sort of melted in storage- so they are sending me new string. I had to stop and adjust the string every 2 feet. For now I'm keeping it- until I see if the fresh string works better. It doesn't cut through the dirt to make a nice edge like a more powerful edger would.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Rambo

customer_reviews.title: The Worx 175 actually makes weed eating fun! Instant gratification for sure
customer_reviews.text: My property has over 200 trees to weed eat around. I nicknamed this Worx 175 "The Bulldog"! It is fabulous! Buy an extra battery and the extra six rolls of string. It's tougher than it looks, for sure! I had a gas powered electric start weed eater that looked tough as iron and didn't work at all. The Worx 175 actually makes weed eating fun! Instant gratification for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Meli H

customer_reviews.title: Batteries and charger and extra string were NOT included
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived and there are no batteries, no charger and no extra string rolls as stated. Warehouse deals are a third party seller, so I either have to return it or buy the parts for a 50% refund, which will not cover the parts. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: SORRY I PURCHASED THIS INFERIOR STRING TRIMMER !
customer_reviews.text: THE TRIMMER IS TOO LIGHT WEIGHT AND CONSTANTLY RUNNING OUT OF STRING ALSO I MIGHT SAY CONSTANTLY LOCKS AND THE AUTOMATIC STRING FEEDER FAILS I HAVE PURCHASED OTHER WORX PRODUCTS AND WAS SATISFIED THIS IS THE WORST MONEY SPENT MY ADVICE IS DON'T PURCHASE THIS ITEM YOU WILL BE SORRY LIKE I AM TODAY.IT DOESN'T EVEN RATE THE ONE STAR. PS THE WHEELS ALSO SLIP OFF NO LOCKING THEM IN PLACE.
customer_reviews.author: George E.Orton, III

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of equipment, but...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of equipment but does require a back-up battery. No matter what anyone says, if you have a fair size front yard and backyard, you need 2 batteries and that's that. Unless you only do 5 minutes of trimming between while charging the battery, you need 2 batteries. And yes, they expensive. But once you have a back-up battery, you're safe for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: The wheel helps so much - as does the light weight!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work, lightweight, does the job well. The perfect solution for those jobs where the heavy duty back-aching weeder is not necessary. In fact, I think this could do the work of the gas hog, but I haven't needed to try it for the thicker weeds yet. Using it yesterday, I realized you can even push down on the wheel if needed - cannot describe how that helps, but it does!
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: it all worked quite smoothly and easily. Great design for so complex and affordable a ...
customer_reviews.text: Have no previous experience with weed whackers, but I'm loving this thing. Despite having a lot of moving parts and options for use/angle, which could be an open invitation to frustration and broken/poorly designed parts, I found that, after reading the manual, it all worked quite smoothly and easily. Great design for so complex and affordable a little machine!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Margaret Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've purchased, and I've bought many!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer and edger has exceeded my expectations! I have a fairly large yard to cover with about 60 feet of sidewalk to keep trimmed. The Worx trimmer does it all and still has enough juice to go around the fence and knock out stray weeds and grass. I thought I'd be changing the rolls of line constantly, but I was wrong. 3 uses around the yard before I finally needed to change the first roll. Don't hesitate on this one. It's well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: Well sorry to say I had to send this one back. I absolutely could not get the guard on it. I don't know if it was defective or what. I will say if it had come put together I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Ormalou

customer_reviews.title: Breezes through the job.
customer_reviews.text: I should probably have my son judge the trimmer, since he is the one using it for me. He indicated it is superior to the one which I was replacing and which is eight years old. Also, the one battery did the whole job. The old trimmer's two batteries had gotten so 'tired' both together were not as effective as the one new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Works but for 1/2 the price perhaps.
customer_reviews.text: It works.. Seems a bit cheap and plastic y - but for the most part it does the job on light weeds and trimming of sidewalk grass.. Not enough HP to do heavy stuff. IMO its worth about 1/2 what I paid though - that's the only remorse so far.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kay (Chicago, Il USA))

customer_reviews.title: ... this for about 3 months now and it works pretty well. I'm 5ft 10in and it seems a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 3 months now and it works pretty well. I'm 5ft 10in and it seems a little short. My only complaint is that it needs to be able to adjust to be longer. It seems to eat through the string pretty fast but you can get free replacements + shipping through the WORX website.
customer_reviews.author: Drak

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait for Weedwhacker season
customer_reviews.text: I run out of energy before the 32 V battery runs out of power. It really made trimming so easy and so environmentally friendly says it works on a rechargeable battery as opposed to the gas powered Weedwhacker’s.
customer_reviews.author: D. Karlsen

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, trimmer trims but it doesn't automatically feed the line. My 5 year old Black and decker put this thing to shame. Save the aggravation do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: dallasfan22

customer_reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised at how well made this product ...
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how well made this product is. For a battery operated trimmer it is surprisingly powerful. It is also very adjustable as to trimming angle and height. Comes with two additional spools of string. Hard to find any fault with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huffs and Puffs
customer_reviews.text: The design of this product is nice but it doesn't have thr stamina to cut through grass regardless of how full the battery charged is. It lasts between 5 to 10 seconds, then it will choke and you'd have to start all over again. I gave it a 1 star only because I couldn't leave it blank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy this edger/trimmer
customer_reviews.text: It works great and changing the cord is really easy. I ordered the free refills from manufacturer and they work great. They did have a shipping charge though. The battery is great and has never run out on me. I usually charge after two uses but could possibly last much more.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFL

customer_reviews.title: I'm already hooked ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This string trimmer works great for a suburban home. As near as I can tell, I have never even come close to dissipating the battery all the way. This trimmer is super versatile, with all kinds of easy adjustments. Works very well as an edge trimmer, too, with the wheels that you click into position when needed. I've only had this trimmer for a few weeks, but I'm already hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G.

customer_reviews.title: This cordless grass trimmer is the greatest tool of its kind I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This cordless grass trimmer is the greatest tool of its kind I've ever owned. It not only trims but edges the grass along the sidewalk with great success. Flip the wheels in another position and it becomes a mini-lawnmower. The 32 volt battery delivers enough power to do more than do an entire lawn. I am very pleased with this machine. If you are intending on buying one make sure you buy extra spools of line because it goes through them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Raboin

customer_reviews.title: Overall great trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works great! It is very versatile. The edger easy to use. My only compliant is the battery life. I can do all of my edging or all of my trimming with one charge, but its not enough to do both without charging.
customer_reviews.author: Commuter

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Whackery
customer_reviews.text: Best whacker I've used. Cordless: Sweet. Adjustable length to save my back: Sweet. Wide whacking area: Sweet. However, I'd advise buying another battery. Mine lasts an estimated 30-45 minutes, I'd say, of constant whackery. Also this does a pretty good job of conserving line. Haven't had to buy any additional line yet. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Jay Gilbo

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: replaced a Stihl trimmer with this one. so easy to use and does a better job that the Stihl. battery lasts a long time after each charge. highly recommend this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D S

customer_reviews.title: Love my new trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Love my new trimmer. I have had corded and gas powered trimmers. With electric/corded trimmers, always having to drag around the extension cord is cumbersome. Gas trimmers always seem to break down after a few years, are difficult to start sometimes. The Worx trimmer has been a pleasure.Easy to use, always ready to go and starts up every time. My only complaint is hand fatigue after heavy use. Not sure anything can be done about that.
customer_reviews.author: K. Struck

customer_reviews.title: Love this workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I know this has been discontinued but I love it. It’s the perfect weight, lots more practical adjustability than most others, I have put this to the test and it’s been a work horse. Battery life is as stated- no surprises so I have extra batteries. I don’t use the mini mower- haven’t found it at all useful but the edger is great
customer_reviews.author: Judy G

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to use. I can now trim my yard myself. I trim my yard and my Parents next door. Battery has yet to run out. I do however charge it directly afterwards and it seems to charge less than the time mentioned which is 3 hours, seems it's more like 2 so that even better. I have arthritis and back issues so I highly recommend this for anyone that has to have a lighter weight trimmer. The reason I gave 4 vs. 5 stars is the instructions are not the best. I had to figure most out myself. The wheels I'm still trying to figure out! Haven't used them yet.... but overall, battery last and it's light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Barley

customer_reviews.title: Charge and battery
customer_reviews.text: Was suppose to get a second battery and didn't. The charge time I wish were better. Had to get replacement strings and they don't hold up to what you first get with the weed eater. Wonder if they're using a thicker strand.
customer_reviews.author: gene mills

customer_reviews.title: Very Good! Nice!
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. lots of adjustments. Good buy dirty oil. hello Clean battery. If you have an average yard (5,000 - 12,000 square feet). this is more than enough for ALL your trimming needs.
customer_reviews.author: The Lopez Family

customer_reviews.title: Very light with great power from the battery
customer_reviews.text: Very light with great power from the battery; but I couldn't get it to feed the string dependably. It drove me crazy, so I had to return it. It's too bad that a fixed blade attachment is not offered.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Help please
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the product the worx does everything that I thought it would do and everything that it advertised however they didn't include the wheels for edging I have mentioned this before I still haven't heard from anyone . Giving 5 stars so someone hopefully will respond to this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Make your yard work easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother for her birthday. She refuses to stop doing lawn work, no matter how old she is. She seemed to like this, but not sure she will know how to use this. I am sure she will do fine, and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy wimpy wimpy!
customer_reviews.text: Although I liked the fact it was lightweight and had an edger feature, I returned it after using it once. I found it to be very wimpy on power. Will most likely replace it with a gas powered one.
customer_reviews.author: crazy_reader

customer_reviews.title: So far works great, have a lot of tall (wet) weeds
customer_reviews.text: So far works great, have a lot of tall (wet) weeds, it went right through. Battery lasted about an hour, but that was through tough weeds. Was worried about the string being so small, but I'm still on my first spindle even after completing a lot of work, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Very versatile. Light weight allows for long continual work. Batteries drain quickly when using it as an edger but it was to be expected. If you edge and wind up kicking up soil often, I’d recommend a second battery (or even a third) depending on the amount of edging you’re doing.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Pavlock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I have had gas operated edgers in the past, and they can be difficult to start and very noisy. Work edger always starts, and is incredibly easy to operate. I didn't think it would have enough power, but it does an excellent job for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Good yard tool.
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually buy cordless tools, but I was getting tired of dragging that big orange cord all the way from the back yard to the front, and two plugged together wouldn't reach all the way. So far, I like this. It has plenty of power to cut all the way around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: CLMW

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Wacker!
customer_reviews.text: This little weed wacker was a good solution for me. I can't use the huge one my husband has, and he's so busy at work, I bought this one so I could attempt to hack down some of the weeds in our yard. This wacker works pretty good-I have transformed our yard from a weed garden to a (nearly) normal yard. I recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to fool around with gas/oil and the little orange dangly thingy that has to be wound, or wrapped or whatever is done.
customer_reviews.author: Coley

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy unless you are a munchkin!
customer_reviews.text: Handle too short extended ! I am 5'8', back ache. Trimmer spool Always tangled, will no self feed.motor is very Good. Battery also very good. Would NOT rebuy!
customer_reviews.author: robert   wells

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. It's very light weight but also very powerful. I use it regularly in the Spring/Summer and even with the default battery (not the extended life one that Worx sells) it can get the whole perimeter of my house done quickly on just one charge. I do like the wheel for that extra stability when I'm getting into tighter spaces. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Best hime trimmer ever.
customer_reviews.text: this is my second Worx trimmer. i bought the original at least 7-8 years ago with the older type of battery and the handle finally broke (understandable) so this was a good reason to get the new one with the new Li-On battery. I LOVE THIS TRIMMER. its so versitile and easy (and quick) to adjust to different trimming situations as you walk around the yard. under bushes, bed edging, sidewalk edging, against fences, so easy. FULLY RECOMMEND for the basic homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bjanes

customer_reviews.title: Light enough for me to adjust and use (I'm 4'10" ...
customer_reviews.text: Light enough for me to adjust and use (I'm 4'10" tall) or for my husband (5'10"). It is for light weeding and edging jobs. We still have some tough weeds out here in the sticks that we have to cut out by hand.
customer_reviews.author: JB in BD

customer_reviews.title: and how easy it is to run
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband, and he is crazy about it, and how easy it is to run. Some of our neighbors have purchased one when they saw how well his works. Great not having a cord.
customer_reviews.author: muffin top lady

customer_reviews.title: I love this weedeater
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this weedeater, had the original about 10 years ago, and is still going, but need a new battery for it, so I decided to buy a whole new one. It's great for me!!!! Would definitely buy another workx....Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: liked it so much I asked to trade in and get a newer model. Of course that didn't work, but I still bought the newer one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Casebolt Jr.

customer_reviews.title: horrible product, line snaps easily
customer_reviews.text: horrible product, line snaps easily. I bought it and realized it's junk and went out 2 weeks later and bought a gas trimmer again. Keep away
customer_reviews.author: George Luce

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast in the 'burbs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Much improved over previous models. I have a typical smallish suburban lawn with three trees, a driveway and backyard that takes about 35 minutes to mow and trim. I know I can trim the entire yard at least 3 times before recharging, though I haven't run the battery to failure yet. The 32 volt motor seems to provide a lot more torque and maybe more speed to the string so the cut is faster and cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: SquidLips

customer_reviews.title: Really great product.  Lightweight and strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weed eater some time ago and I have to say it works really well. Its light weight and perfect for my smaller garden. I really like the way the battery lasts for the entire time I need it. Really easy to use. I already own the Worx Multi purpose blower and now have added this to my gardening needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for the last couple months and it is working great. The battery has plenty of life and the wheels on the unit make it easier to do a clean job when cutting a grassy area that is unsuitable for using a lawn mower. The line cartridges are easy to change out.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisB

customer_reviews.title: I soldered it back on and it has been working great ever since
customer_reviews.text: Terminal connector on motor broke off and the motor would cut in and out because of this.. I soldered it back on and it has been working great ever since!
customer_reviews.author: SirDigitalKnight

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: I really like this type of weedeater and it worked well for about a year. I purchased it 7/25/17 and the motor went out on 8/17/18. I am really disappointed in the length of time that it lasted. I did purchase another but it will be the last if it doesn't last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well but doesn't edge that great. I've used it for over a year and it's good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! Works as advertised. 20 volt batteries do not work. Sad!!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Great product, love adjustable head and wheels
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Adjustable head so you can also do edging is great. Not to heavy and wheels make it very easy to use. Easy ordering and quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: elanekct

customer_reviews.title: This is terrific!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, and it is my "go to" tool for almost everything. Easy to handle, light in weight, and tough on weeds and tall grasses.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

product_meta.title: WORX 32-Volt GT2.0 String Trimmer/Edger/Mini-Mower with Tilting Head and Single Line Feed
product_meta.description: The cordless WORX 32-volt Lithium MAX Powered Grass Trimmer and Edger has taken grass trimming and edging to a whole new level of power and function. With the 32-volts of MAX lithium battery power, the WG175 provides longer run times and more power. The 12-inch cutting diameter means more trimming in less time. Not only will this cordless trimmer convert to an edger in seconds, but it is also a mini mower. It has dual-positioned in-line wheels that make edging a breeze. The wheels can also be used as a "mowing-like" function for detailed trimming around landscape or hard to reach areas. A quick-release trigger lever is convenient for making easy height adjustments to the telescopic shaft for comfort and control. The trimmer head turns with a pull and turn to lock and convert to edging. MAX lithium battery power means more battery capacity, longer runtimes, no self-discharge, no slow loss of power, less weight, more power and quicker charging times. With this 32-volt lithium battery, expect up to 35 minutes of runtime on low speed for normal grass conditions. Charge the battery within 3 hours and it will be ready when you need it with no self-discharge. From function to features, the 32-volt WORX trimmer and edger features 100% single line feed which means no bumping to extend the line. A flower space guard not only helps protect vegetation, but also acts as an edger guide. A front auxiliary handle has 7 locking adjustments for maximum comfort while trimming, edging, or mowing. Weighing in at only 6-pounds, this 32-volt grass trimmer, edger and mini mower will create a professional looking yard with less work, less fatigue and less time.
feature_bullets: Comes with one 32V MaxLithium battery, 3 trimmer spools and charger
3-in-1 Capability with dual-position wheels for grass trimming, edging, and mowing. The battery and charger are packaged separately from the tool, but in the same box.
Converts from a trimmer to an in-line edger in seconds with no tools
Quick-release lever for fast telescopic height adjustments, and for the 90-degree tilting head
12-inch cutting diameter with automatic 100% single line feed (no bump)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars999 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
